definition: to make a draft/to draw up (plans)

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

pinyin: da4 hui4 bao4 gao4 qi3 cao3 ren2

sentences.english: “No dole, ” he instructed the legislative drafting team.
sentences.chinese: “没有救济金，”他这样指示立法起草小组。

sentences.english: Are you drawing up the documents?
Review draft report in closing meeting with all process owners.
sentences.chinese: 在结束会上和所有程序拥有者一道检查起草报告。

sentences.english: The whole contract has to be redrafted to take in the objection from the chairman.
sentences.chinese: 为了接受董事长的异议，整个合同都必须重新起草。

sentences.english: 8-11. Why? One difficulty is to construct the agreements.
sentences.chinese: 为何？困难之一是起草这些协议。

sentences.english: It was right then I started thinking about Thomas Jefferson…
sentences.chinese: 没错，我很尽看，于是我开始考虑杰弗逊起草的。

sentences.english: The council prepares the annual Economic Report of the President.
sentences.chinese: 该委员会每年负责起草《总统经济年度报告》。

sentences.english: Mr Li asks Mr Yang to draft the contract, which will be signed by the two parties the following morning.
sentences.chinese: 李先生让杨先生起草合同，双方将在第二天早晨签字。

sentences.english: The drafting unit shall make the minutes of the demonstration meeting.
sentences.chinese: 起草单位应当就论证会制作会议记录。

sentences.english: They laid their objections to paper in a document called the Flushing Remonstrance.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者起草了一份文件，称为《法拉盛抗议书》。

sentences.english: After the war the two country draw up a disgreement.
sentences.chinese: 战后两国起草了一个合约。

sentences.english: Members from the drafting group introduce the mock policy address during a press conference.
sentences.chinese: 起草小组成员于新闻发布会上介绍模拟施政报告。

sentences.english: The mayor had the Ninth Five-Year Plan drafted.
sentences.chinese: 市长让人起草了第九个五年计划。

sentences.english: Its drafter's intention was to put sovereignty in the hands of the people .
sentences.chinese: 起草人的意图是要把国家主权置于人民手中。

sentences.english: His energy policy was written by Mr Cheney with the help of a handful of cronies from the energy industry.
sentences.chinese: 他的能源措施由切尼先生和少数大能源集团起草。

sentences.english: He teamed with Chinese Premier Wen Jiabao to draft a late-night compromise.
sentences.chinese: 他和中国总理温家宝连夜共同起草了一份折衷协定。

definition: first draft/to draw up (a first version)
to issue/to proclaim/to enact (laws, decrees etc)
to lead (an animal by the head)/to take the lead/to coordinate (a combined operation)/to mediate/a go-between (e.g. marriage broker)
proposal/draft resolution/motion (to be debated)/to propose a bill/to make a proposal
to present/to give/to hand over/to hand in/to lay before
to write comments on a report submitted by a subordinate/written comments from a superior
to draft/to draw up/to compose (a plan or document)
